availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry S. Luckett (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Son of D. Lawton Luckett and Huldah Luckett. Resident of Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Household employed one additional enslaved person in Henry County in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant from December 24, 1861 to January 2, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 435B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 428.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, 190B, 194A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, New Castle, p. 342B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0205.
